snippet: Boko Haram struck Bosso, a local seat of government in Niger, extending the conflict to a fourth country; an officer from Niger said the attackers had been repelled.
abstract: Islamic militant group Boko Haram crosses Nigerian border and attacks town of Bosso, Niger, expanding number of countries involved in area conflict to four.
lead_paragraph: Boko Haram struck Bosso, a local seat of government in Niger, extending the conflict to a fourth country; an officer from Niger said the attackers had been repelled.

headline.main: Boko Haram Widens Fight, Striking Niger
